attributes.action: Take care of the working class taxpayers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We hear of billion pound bailouts and tax cuts, but who pays for it?...the taxpayer.if government debts need paying off, dont borrow taxpayers money then penalise them in the future. why cant the government reduce their personal spenditure, reduce the handouts of benefits, impose a benefits scheme to bailed out banks to help us since our tax money helped bail them out. where would the banks be if no bailout was offered? it seems to be all take and no give. tax rises are not the answer to everything and the government need to listen to the public, put themselves in the shoes of a hard-working families that are worse off working than not.the government are too scared of affending their 'rich friends' than listening to the general taxpaying community.

the government has destroyed public trust, over and over again.

REDUCE benefits
CUT government personal spending
FOCUS on British issues rather than trying to save the world
LISTEN to the taxpayers more
HELP the suffers not penalise them

rejection.details: Your title and petition should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement, about Government policy.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
